alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains; Northern Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 01 at 8:05PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: A strong storm system is expected to move into the region Thursday night and continuing to impact the area through early Saturday. The initial impact of this system will be widespread moderate snow which will be followed by breezy conditions with wind gusts of 30 to 40 mph expected from Friday night into Saturday morning. A few higher mountain locations will see stronger wind speeds. Speeds of this magnitude combined with leaves and possible snow on the trees could lead to damage and subsequent power outages. Another round of light to moderate snow is expected for the latter half of the weekend followed by much colder temperatures for next week with the continued chances for snow. Significant snow is expected to occur over most of the area mountain passes through early next week, especially near the Cascade Crest.
